intro: Pharnaceum denticulatum, commonly known as the toothed pharnaceum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely toothed leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in woodland areas. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is notable for its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
